fields.title: Graphic Design
fields.overview:
About 38% of consumers won’t use your platforms if they don’t find your layout interactive. Human
eyes are one of the greatest assets every brand can tap into. This makes visual first impressions
critical to engagement and business success. In today’s digital space, graphic, web, and interactive
designers must be flexible and appropriate in the evolving world of technology and visual culture.

The Graphic Design course from Instinct Hub will provide you with the technical skills and
creative knowledge needed to make a start in this profession, to equip participants with a strong
foundation in visual communications. In this programme, participants would learn how to use
Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign to create compelling designs for both print and Web
platforms. Participants would also learn about the business of graphic design and creating a
professional portfolio.

fields.title: Introduction to Design
fields.description: Walk within the process of a design analysis, discover how to translate design goals and exercise giving and receiving project feedback. Learn user-centered design techniques that businesses use to enhance their product experiences.

fields.title: The Essence of Graphic Design
fields.description: Learn about the scope and history of graphic design. Define graphic design, review some differences between design and art. Discover some of the most influential graphic designers who shaped the industry.

fields.title: Getting knowledge of Digital Images
fields.description: Learn aspects of computer literacy to graphic design, and the basics of graphic design best practices. Understand important file extension.  And understand the elements of digital images.

fields.title: Introduction to Adobe Creative Suite
fields.description:
Learn how to use Adobe software like Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign.
•	Understand the strengths and limitations of Adobe Illustrator.
•	Distinguish the different elements of the Illustrator interface.
•	Exercise possible formats.
•	Exercise drawing simple patterns and adjust the size, circle, and color
•	Identify the smooth workflow between photoshop and illustrators

fields.title: Visual Design and Layout Composition
fields.description: Learn the elements of visual design. Create your digital media files using Adobe Photoshop. Examine options for choosing typography for a site that offers a smooth experience. Learn how to layout design for the deferent medium.

fields.title: Design Ideation and Research
fields.description: Discover how to go about producing innovative ideas and delivering them to clients and team members. Use helpful idea creation tools such as brainstorming, targeting and scamping. Also, identify how to avoid plagiarism.

fields.title: Principle of Typography and the usage
fields.description: Discover how to scale-up layouts with appropriate fonts. Examine commonly used typographic terms. Distinguish the differences between generally used words for “font” and “typeface”

fields.title: Designs for Printing Purpose
fields.description: Learn critical and simple methods of prints layout. Get familiar with industry offset prints. Articulate steps of getting the document ready for print. Set colors and modes using Adobe Illustrator.

fields.title: Designing for the Web
fields.description: Learn a web-based design approach. Get a real understanding of the design role and the role of a developer. Use a web development approach to identify technical needs for website development. And increase your design aesthetics decision.

fields.title: Build your Career around Design
fields.description: Build and curate a collection of your work that will most perfectly reflect what you value as a designer, what it looks like working with you, and finally, what to expect in terms of your output. Learn methods for giving effective presentations so you can help model decisions, influence change, and create an impact on the businesses.
